title: Printed Typeface References (Fontbook) can anyone recommend me any others?
content:
Hi all,

At present I do not own any Printed Font Reference guides/books. As I am tyring to become more serious about my design work and are interested in becoming a better designer, owning a few of these (which I didnt even know existed) hopefully would benefit me.

I see the Fontbook is availabe, does any know what year this was last updated?  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/products/fontbook/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091012074055/http:/www.fontshop.com/products/fontbook/ "http://www.fontshop.com/products/fontbook/")

I also see the Font Bureau Third Edition Specimen Book but that was published in 2001.  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/books/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091012074055/http:/www.fontbureau.com/books/ "http://www.fontbureau.com/books/")

Can anyone recommend any other printed referenes or free online PDF’s etc.

Any help would be great
author: TF22Raptor

comments.content: The “Made with FontFont” book is also nice. A few foundries still mail out printed catalogs periodically, House Industries, Hoefler, maybe others. And nearly all of the foundries have downloadable PDF specimens that you can print yourself.
Linotype sells a good specimen, although I think that most of the (non-novelty) designs appear in Fontbook.
